24744126.review:
Panzercops ist sowas wie ein modernes Panzergeneral

Das Spiel ist ein Hex - Feld Spiel wie Civilisation oder andere Spiele dieses Genres.

Es gibt haufenweise DLCs und Maps die aber alle kostenpflichtig dazu gekauft werden müssen.

Da wir aber vom 1. Teil ohne Add ons reden beginnt mein Review hier:

Man spielt die deutsche Wehrmacht und man  beginnt mit einem Tutorial. Vorausgesetzt man wünscht es. 

Es gibt verschiedene an Klick Möglichkeiten die verschiedene Abschnitte der Geschichte widerspiegeln wie zum Beispiel der Einmarsch in Polen usw.

Das Spiel ist nicht hundertprozentig auf die Geschichte aufgebaut da man je nach Gewinn und verlieren Möglichkeiten sogar die USA bombardieren kann, dass ich jetzt aber nicht Spoilern möchte.

Das Spiel selbst abgesehen von den Feldern die ich erwähnt habe ist Runden basierend und meist zeitlich festgelegt d.h. man muss in gewissen Runden verschiedene Ziele erreichen und das meist so Verlust arm, wie möglich.

Es gibt meist noch ein Bonus Content wenn man das Ziel in gewissen Zeiten erreicht also schneller ist als das ursprünglich geforderte Ziel bekommt man meist einem Bonus. 

Der Bonus ist entweder ein Spezialpanzer oder Prestige (Geld)

Die sogenannten Prestige bekommt man wenn man Städte einnimmt und für viele andere kleine Mission. 

Prestige können entweder verwendet werden um Einheiten zu heilen neue Einheiten zu kaufen und zu upzugraden usw.

Es gibt viele Möglichkeiten in diesem Spiel seinen Weg zu gehen dennoch jeder verlorene Panzer wird spürbar im Spiel sein.

Panzercops ist ein sehr strategisch und taktisches Spiel je nach Einstellmöglichkeiten mit oder ohne Kriegsnebel usw.jeder zug sollte gut überdacht werden, da das Spiel selten Fehler verzeiht.

Man sollte Boden Beschaffenheit wie Wald, Hügel, Flüsse usw. gut ein Planen da jede Einheit positiv oder negativ reagiert.

Man wird viel Zeit mit Zahlen vergleichen verbringen also sollte man etwas Geduld mitbringen in diesem Spiel.

Je nachdem wie man spielt bekommen deine Einheiten auch Erfahrungspunkte die dann in Sterne dargestellt werden d.h. abgesehen von ihren Werten bringt jeder Stern etwa +1 Einheiten mit d.h. wenn die Einheit +10 hat kann sie nachher +15 oder so haben.

Dies macht natürlich manche Einheiten wertvoller und der Verlust schmerzt höher.

Nett ist auch dass die Einheiten je nach Kampferfahrung bis zu 3 Helden bekommen die dann leider zufällige Werte bringen. Hier wäre vielleicht eine Möglichkeit zur Anpassung bzw. zum verschieben der Helden schön gewesen. 

Auch können die Einheiten verschiedene Orden bekommen die aber eher einen optischen Reiz bringen hier wäre vielleicht der ein oder andere Wert auch noch gut gekommen.

Ich konnte nachlesen das mit den Addon´s wohl noch das ein oder andere möglich wäre. 

Aber ich habe in meinen 107 Stunden Spielzeit nur den 1. Teil gespielt, noch nicht mal eines der Add ons. (Mehrmals neugestartet)

Technisch ist dieses Spiel eher wie ein Browsergame aufgebaut was aber bei einem rein 2-D Spiel nicht wirklich schlimm ist.

Auch testete ich es schon auf einem nicht zu hardwarestarken Netbook, und es läuft sehr gut. 

Ich kann es also auch für Leute empfehlen die gerne mal leistungsschwache Systeme nutzen.

Auch zu erwähnen ist vielleicht das es neben der Kampagne noch einen Haufen DLC Maps gibt die historische Schlachten nachspielen.

Für den ein oder anderen der nicht weiter kommt gibt es sogar Cheats

Und ein Multiplayer den ich selbst aber noch nie genutzt habe. Leider nur 1 VS 1 hier wäre vielleicht ein Koop sogar ganz geil gekommen, oder die Möglichkeit die Kampagne als Gegner gegeneinander zu spielen.

Auch gibt es eine kleine Communitie die gerne auch mal kostenlose Maps zur Verfügung stellen ich selbst habe es aber noch nicht genutzt.

Man könnte noch viel schreiben aber ich finde das Detail dazu würde den Rahmen sprengen.

Mein Fazit zu diesem Spiel:

Es ist liebevoll gestaltet (2-D Art) ich empfinde es recht gut Balanced aber auch sehr schwer.

Die Einheiten sind klug gewählt dennoch etwas mehr Hintergrund Information über die Einheiten wäre wünschenswert gewesen.

Das Heldensystem und Ordenssystem könnte besser sein ist aber vollkommen ausreichend.

Ein Kritikpunkt meinerseits wäre das Zeitlimit. Ich persönlich hätte mir gewünscht, das ausstellen zu können. 

Da es irgendwie immer etwas Druck vermittelt. Dies ist natürlich aber nur meine persönliche Vorliebe.

Technisch läuft das Spiel auf jedem Rechner bzw. auf jeden einigermaßen modernen Rechner.

Nett ist auch die kleine Bibliothek ingame die Zeichnung über Panzer usw. zeigen.

Auch die deutsche Übersetzung ist meiner Meinung nach sehr gut

Und man bekommt für das zugegeben nicht ganz billige Spiel einen echten Zeit fresser.

Dennoch sollte man beim Kauf sich im klaren sein das dieses Spiel Retro ist und auch das Spielesystem ist es. 

So kann es bei dem ein oder anderen sicherlich einen Frustfaktor auslösen.

Dennoch aus meiner Sicht klare Kaufempfehlung es gibt nicht viele solcher Spiele die so ähnlich sind wie Panzer General.

24317708.review:
第二次世界大戦のドイツ軍を題材としたターン制ストラテジー。キャンペーンはドイツ軍しかないが、シナリオでは連合軍（米・英・ソ）もプレイ可能。良い点と悪い点を書いていく。

良い点
・陸・空のユニットが豊富
・ゲームバランスが良い
・コアユニットと経験値システム
・戦闘時において運要素がある
・ライブラリー
・エディター


・陸、空のユニットが豊富
Ⅳ号戦車やメッサーシュミットなどの派生型がある。公式によると800種類のユニット（陸、空、海含む全てのユニット）が登場すると書いてある。

・ゲームバランスが良い
日本製のターン制ストラテジー（某第二次世界大戦の大戦略）に比べてゲームバランスがとられている。そのため、戦闘機で戦車を全滅させることは不可能であり、当然戦闘機無双もできない。一部を除いて（コアユニットと経験値システムで説明する）基本的に無双はできないと考えた方がいい。戦車砲や対空砲などそれぞれの兵科に役割があり、無駄な兵科がないのも好印象。しかし対空砲は若干弱く感じた。

・コアユニットと経験値システム
　コアユニットとは、キャンペーンの始まりから終わりまで継続して運用できるユニットのことをいう。普通のユニットだと各ステージでしか運用できないため、経験値システムとの関わりはほぼない。一方、コアユニットは継続して運用できるため、経験値が蓄積されていき強化されたユニットになる。「ゲームバランスが良い」の項目で書いた「一部を除いて」というのは、この強化されたユニットのことを指す。しかし、強化されたユニットを多く作ることはできないだろう。強化されたユニットでも必ず被害を受ける。その時にユニットを修理する必要があるのだが、修理方法は経験値を維持したまま多くのコストを使って修理するか経験値を減らす代わりに修理コストをカットするかの２つある。経験値を維持したまま修理すればするほど資金がなくなり、新しいユニットが出てきても買うことができないなどの弊害が出てくる。そのため、強化されたユニットを多く作ることは不可能だろう。しかし、この仕様のおかげでゲームバランスを崩すことなく適度な爽快感を与えてくれる。
追記：それぞれの兵器には相性があるので、強化された経験値Maxのユニットで攻撃しても相性の悪い敵ユニットに対しては戦果を期待できない。例えば、対地能力の低い戦闘機が歩兵ユニットを攻撃しても戦果は期待できない。

・戦闘時において運要素がある
　敵ユニットを攻撃する時、自分のユニットの損害と敵ユニットの損害の両方の予測が表示されるが、それ通りにならないことがある。具体的な戦闘の詳細は「コントロールキー押しながら敵ユニットに左クリック」すると表示される。戦闘の詳細が分からずに、予測を目安にして戦っても問題はない。ところで、なぜこれを良い点にしたかというと戦争に運はつきものだと思うからである。

・ライブラリ
イラスト付きの兵器の説明。ゲームとは全く関係ないが見ていて楽しい
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=724357973
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=724358460

・エディター
自分でシナリオを作成できる。


悪い点
・海軍ユニットが少ない
・英語表記なので多少不便
・時間が経つとPCが若干重くなる


・海軍ユニットが少ない
このゲームのタイトルが「Panzer Corps」なので海軍ユニットは補助的な役割になっている。海軍ユニットは存在するものの、ドイツは巡洋戦艦、戦艦、重巡洋艦、軽巡洋艦、潜水艦、汎用揚陸艇の各1種類のみである。戦艦は「battleship」、重巡洋艦は「Heavy Cruiser」と表記されており、ビスマルクやプリンツ・オイゲンなど固有名詞のユニットとして登場しない。個人的には少し寂しい。しかし、一部例外としてUボートは存在する。（wikiによるとドイツ海軍の保有する潜水艦の総称なので固有名詞ではないか…）


・英語表記
私も含む日本人にとっては不便である。世界標準語だから仕方がない。英語ができなくても直感的に遊ぶことは可能。しかし、最低でも目標は理解できるようにしたい。

・時間が経つとPCが若干重くなる
恐らく個人の環境によるものだろう。他の方のレビューを見たとき、それらしきレビューは書かれていなかった。


その他
DLC版だが、ルーデルやハルトマンなど実在していた軍人がエースユニットとして登場する。ゲームでもルーデルは強い、強すぎる。


総評　9/10
第二世界大戦のターン制ストラテジーとしては完成度の高い素晴らしいゲームである。
買って損はないだろう。もし心配ならプレイ動画を見たり、セール時に購入することをお勧めする。

23704173.review:
Por cortesía de Slitherine he podido probar el PanzerCorps con los tres DLCs norteamericanos, y la verdad es que estoy bastante satisfecho. 
Como los más veteranos recuerdan, el Panzer Corps es heredero directo del Panzer General 2. Estamos ante un juego de estrategia por turnos en que el mapa se divide en hexágonos y en cada uno se despliega y combate una unidad, que tiene fuerzas entre 1 y 15. 
La gracia de la estos juegos son sus campañas en las cuales vas creando un núcleo de tropas que vas manteniendo batalla tras batalla para lograr llegar hasta el objetivo final. 
En estos DLCs que voy  a comentar llevamos a las tropas norteamericanas desde el desembarco en el norte de África hasta Berlín.
Llama a la atención especialmente lo bien pensado que está el uso de los mapas muy detallados y su conjunción con las unidades los desafíos a los que se enfrenta el jugador hace que cada mata y que cada batalla sea muy muy difícil. Como dice el proverbio no hay enemigo pequeño especialmente si está atrincherado en una montaña y tú no tienes apoyo aéreo. 
Las tropas que puedes utilizar durante esta campaña aliadas, pero no te dan opción en muchos escenarios a comprar otras que no sean yankees, de manera que tus fuerzas serán casi seguro 100% USA. Sin embargo si vas teniendo éxito en la misma puedes obtener unidades capturadas, lo cual le da un toque bastante interesante de realismo al a la campaña. He conseguido terminar la campaña del 42 con un Sd.Kfc de 8 ruedas y un Panzer IIIN y la verdad es que da un toque exótico muy de agradecer. También te enfrentarás a batallones equipados con material capturado, incluido algún carro Churchill que dará dolores de cabeza.
Me ha gustado mucho el desarrollo dinámico de los escenarios: Inicialmente empiezas con los objetivos preestablecidos como cualquier otro como en cualquier otra misión o escenario en juegos similares. Sin embargo según se va desarrollando la acción puedes encontrarte con nuevos objetivos, nuevas misiones o diversas novedades o sucesos que alteran tu plan de batalla.
Por ejemplo nos podemos encontrar con que al principio de la batalla  nos impiden desplegar unidades aéreas porque se han utilizado para para otro frente o se nos pide que no despleguemos todas las unidades terrestres porque se necesitarán algunas para un desembarco anfibio posterior durante la batalla…. Todos esos detalles hacen que la experiencia de juego sea bastante interesante y que te permita una cierta flexibilidad y dinamismo que no encontrábamos en los PG clásicos. 
Es especialmente importante  la gestión del prestigio a la hora de comprar y reforzar unidades. La división entre las mismas es la tradicional: infantería, tanques, antitanques, AA, reconocimiento, artillería, cazas, bombarderos tácticos y bombarderos estratégicos. Tienes que ser muy listo para hacer grupos de combate suficientemente flexibles como para enfrentarse a todos los desafíos que te vas a encontrar ( créeme, todo Shermans no es la solución ), y, a la vez, que no sean prohibitivos de reforzar, manteniendo un delicado equilibrio, especialmente durante las batallas entre las unidades que vas a dejar atrás por falta de refuerzos y las que necesitas seguir manteniendo en forma para sostener el avance.  En general, en este punto, las 3 campañas están bien diseñadas y te dan suficiente prestigio para seguir adelante. 
Como ya sabréis sin duda, y sino lo repito, se puede pagar por refuerzos novatos, baratos pero que bajan la experiencia, o refuerzos de élite que permiten mantener el nivel, pagando sus buenos puntos de prestigio. Del delicado equilibrio entre unos y otros depende conseguir un grupo de combate que aguante hasta el final de la campaña. 
Esto es especialmente importante en estos 3 DLCs. Cada uno de ellos abarca un escenario: Norte de África, Italia y Frente Europeo. El grupo de combate puede pasarse de un DLC a otro, lo que te da una enorme ventaja con los norteamericanos, que de salida tienen tanques más débiles que los alemanes, y dependen mucho de su artillería y aviación. 
A un par de escenarios de entrenamiento, fáciles y dirigidos sobre todo a los que empiezan a jugar, le sigue ya un desembarco en el Norte de África, que mal gestionado puede poner la campaña peliaguda. Y eso sin necesidad de que aparezcan los alemanes. 
Curiosamente, en esta campaña, el Afrika Korps es el coco, pero los mayores quebraderos de cabeza me los han dado los italianos que con sus tanques ligeros se infiltran en la retaguardia obligándote a desviar otros tanques o antitanques para pararlos. Además, en terreno montañoso, son enemigos formidables y más de una misión me he pasado por los pelos porque los bersaglieri italianos se pegaban al terreno como lapas. 
Mención especial, por supuesto, la Batalla de Kasserine. Durisima, con un mapa muy amplio, y con múltiples frentes entrelazados en que la ruptura por un lado podía suponer una retirada en todos los puntos. 
Una vez echas al Eje del Norte de África, pasas a Sicilia, donde harás la labor sucia a Patton para tomar Palermo. Esa isla montañosa con caminos estrechos va a suponer un buen desafío a tus tanques e ingenieros, que lo pasarán mal para abrirse camino sin posibilidades de flanqueo. 
En Europa, no hay esos problemas. Y no hay italianos. Solo granaderos alemanes, panthers, tigers y bocage. Más te vale tener un buen grupo de combate veterano porque sino te quedarás atascado sin remedio. Cuida especialmente tus cazas…
En definitiva, tres buenos DLCs, que aunque pueden adquirirse por separado, la gracia, a mi entender, es tenerlos juntos para poder disfrutar de una experiencia plena como comandante norteamericano, con escenarios variados, bien pensados, y que en ningún momento te lo ponen fácil.

23492579.review:
A grand tactical, turned-based war game with roots in hex based board games from the good old days.  The very simple mechanics provide a very tactical feel--the type of unit and the order in which they move and shoot is a core concept:  the game rewards good combined arms tactics (as does real life)--that keeps the game moving without being bogged down in tactical details (other titles provide that fix).  You also get a strategy game since you must decide on what battles to fight, and based on prestige gained in your battles, what equipment to buy or upgrade or overstrength, where to deploy to start and then plan a course of action.  This provides a role playing aspect as you must decide on how to build your core and then grow your units in experience by earning awards via combat efficiency and potentially gaining a hero that then provides additional tactical benefits to the unit.  It has another what if aspect when building the core:  do I go armor heavy and win with tanks or dominate with air power disregarding that artillery is the king of battle or use recon or airborne or engineers or other options to explore or replay trying a completely different mix (seapower is used but not as part of your core with the capital ships all historically named--that is awesome).  You can be rewarded with some Special Experience units that add to you core and provide extra assets that come in very handy when used properly.

The scale of the maps and the number of units always gives you room to manuever (some reviews disagree):  it is another key concept.  The base game requires you to move out and take your objectives (some have said that is a detractor--but good tactics can overcome this issue and you may need every turn to get that decisive victory).  The DLCs allow some flexibility by providing an adjustment to ease the hurried feeling.  The situations in the scenarios (maps) are always interesting and contain solid historical and actual geographic elements plus at times actual units or leaders for the particular battle.  The DLC's add some very challenging tactical twists using very innovative objectives.  The DLC's also provide some surprises both as tactical problems or a very special reinforcement to your core (some very powerful units with perhaps a potential flaw) and some rewards for good battlefield management via captured equipment (a very nice touch).

It is just fun and addicting: you ALWAYS want to play just one more turn and that will get you in serious trouble with the significant other!  I played Panzer General (and some other titles in the 5 Star series) and this game has taken the original concept far beyond that great start.  The DLCs push the limits even more.  Bravo Zulu Matrix and Slitherine!

23106297.review:
Pour qui connait Panzer General, il n'y a pas grand chose à apprendre sur ce Panzer Corps. C'est une espèce de Remaster d'un grand classique du Wargame WWII édité par Slitherine (spécialite du genre). 

Vu toutes les reviews dispo depuis quelques temps, et le style de celui-ci n'étant pas dans sa technique, il faut retenir l'expérience sur le terrain (et le comparer au classique du genre Panzer General dont il s'inspire directement et toute la clique de wargame WWII tour par tour qui sont de plus en plus légion sur le store). 

On note tout d'abord un véritable équilibrage entre les différents types d'unité. Sur un vieux Panzer General, je me rappelle que ça tenait de l'exploit que de réussir à descendre un Tigre avec des fatassins. 
Les bonus/malus de position n'est pas frappant (une unité fantassin tenant une ville n'aura pas de gros bonus de défense). 
Les bombardements stratégiques n'ont pas une énorme incidence au coup (par contre, une orgie contre les unités navales). 
Les bombardements tactiques, par contre, peuvent être d'un salut efficace face à des unités blindés trop pressantes. 

Sinon, l'esprit de la chose (du WWII) est respecté. C’est en Union soviétique que les rouges brisent les reins de la Wehrmacht, bien avant le débarquement des Alliés en France. Après, on s'y perd un peu en scénario et le jeu s'attarde toujours autant sur l'ouest avec toute la quincaillerie anglo-saxonne lors du débarquement allié. Résultat, Overlord est clairement la partie la plus dur du jeu (à mon sens) lorsqu'on joue l'Axe. Il faut vraiment économiser un max pour préparer cette map. 

...en mm temps, si l'esprit historique était respecté, avec une seul unité de Tigre II, j'aurai dû pouvoir bouffer tous les blindés alliés en moins de 5 tours et reprendre position avec mes unités de fantassin lors du débarquement ... ouais, tiens, je vais demander à me faire rembourser ! Y'a arnaque ! 


A noter, j'ai pu voir (mais pas jouer) un mod excellent sur le Workshop de ce jeu. Je sais déjà que j'y reviendrai. 

On peut peut-être le trouver un peu cher (si on prend en compte sa date de sortie) mais vaut son prix. 
Pour moins cher, on peut se tourner vers Panzer Tactics.

Jugué una campaña completa, en nivel fácil con los Alemanes, es un lujo ganarla al completo, terminas conquistando USA, en 3 escenarios, de Este a Oeste, ante nosotros tenemos el juego clásico que jugamos en su día, con pequeñas mejoras, y sobre todo que funciona perfectamente en nuestros PC de hoy día, el juego tengo que recomendarlo, esta muy chulo.

El juego jugarlo en nivel mariscal, creo que es imposible, la máquina es abrumadoramente superior a Alemania, cosa rara sobre todo en la invasión de polonia, que el ejercito Alemán, tenía mal equipamiento, pero en aviación y en tropas era muy superior, aquí te dan de partida en campaña muy pocas unidades y solo un caza y un bombardero, resultado, fracaso total en completar campaña en nivel mariscal, ya que cuando pase a paises bajos, la máquina tenía en las capitales, artillería antiaereos, blindados, infantería y cañones antitanques, aparte aviación cazas y bombarderos, y tu como Alemania tienes practicamente, nada, de unidades y si compras, tampoco puedes arreglar las que tienes en fin en nivel mariscal imposible, porque la máquina repara todas las unidades, osea si no exterminas la unidad al siguiente turno la tienes recuperada, cuando tu apenas tienes puntos para recuperar tus unidades, o comprar más.

Puntos negativos del juego, no se pueden hacer capturas del juego para subirlas a Steam el F12 no funciona.

Su punto MÁS negativo es que NO esta traducido al Castellano, la 2 lengua más importante del Mundo, y que sería sencillo ya que no hay cinemáticas ni nada.

Por lo demás esta bien lo recomiendo pero para comprar rebajado claro.

Añado compré todos los DLC de GRAN Campaña, y es una GOZADA que al terminar una campaña puedas continuar con la siguiente con las mismas unidades y toda su exp ganada, así si que se puede conseguir un excelente ejército.
Otro punto negativo grande siguen siendo los LIMITES DE TURNOS, algo que aunque sea un juego de estrategia siempre me molestó mucho.

Por supuesto también comprar estos DLC rebajados, no dejan de ser más mapas para la campaña, no tiene nada más, alguna unidad nueva tal vez pero si no es rebajado no vale lo que piden.

Suerte.

Im Szenario als Brite eher einfach...genau so spielt es sich.

Ich empfehle euch diverse andere Mods, z. b. die von DMP (Afrika, Ostfront oder Pazifik)

22615581.review:
Basic, turn based, hex map WW2 wargame. Looks and plays very like the old Panzer General from back in the day.

I played through PanzerCorps on an iPad some time ago and now I've started replaying it on PC with all the DLC that was not available when I played on iPad. I mention that because, from what I've seen so far, its pretty much identical to the iPad version.

Graphically its functional, but not pretty. Running at 1080p, the graphics look drab/blurry/grainy. Its like they took an old 640x480/800x600 screen and just upscaled it. The UI is messy and clunky. The boxes look the wrong size, menu icons look too small and theres a lot of 'wasted space' that could be used to display useful ingame information like terrain type/effects that aren't necessarily clear from the map. The 'clunky' feel applies to the whole thing, from save games to scernario editing. On the upside you get a lot of maps/scenarios for your money. At £35(ish) for the complete set, thats a good deal if you like 'basic, turnbased, hexmap WW2 wargames'.

As for the battles ...... the combat results seem to have a wide range, so predicting the outcome of a battle is always uncertain. You think your unit of 109s should be able to take out the unit of Stukas in the tutorial mission? You may be surprised and find you need all three of your 109 units - and they end up taking more casualties than the Stukas! And don't trust those computer generated combat result predictions, they are downright fantasy.

The AI seems to have some abilities you don't, so it happily reinforces its units in circumstances you couldn't, marches out of nowhere to attack your rear echelon units that it couldn't 'see' beforehand ..... etc.

The AI is neither stupid nor particularly competent - but its unique 'abilities', your limited unit choices, scenario time restrictions, combat result uncertainty .... etc .... usually make for a challenging game.

Anyway, I bought it again! Partly for old times sake, partly because I like it despite its glaring flaws, partly because theres a lot of game for your money, partly because its so undemanding it runs on just about any old PC ...... and the hex based ww2 genre isn't exactly crowded.

22583821.review:
Skvělá tahová strategie. Cena se může zdát poněkud vysoká, obzvlášť pokud zhodnotíte grafické zpracování. Tahle hra opravdu nevyniká grafikou, ale samotné jádro je funkční a hratelnost vynikající. I tak si myslím, že hra může zaujmout pouze lidi, které zajímá buď historie druhé světové války nebo alespoň druhoválečná vojenská technika.

 Základní hra nabízí pomerně přímočarou kampaň, ale i tak zabere několik desítek hodin a určitě ji na poprvé ani nedohrajete. Už i normální obtížnost(z celkem pěti) je poměrně obtížná a každé chyby budete litovat. Mezi kampaněmi se totiž přenášejí vaše jednotky, takže pokud ztratíte elitní tankovou divizi SS(ve hře není toto označení použito) tak už ji jednoduše nemáte. Ve hře je taky systém zkušeností, a rozdíl mezi rekruty a elitní jednotkou je velký. Výborný je taky systém jednotek, které nakupujete za prestiž - ale nakupujete si co chcete z aktuálně dostupných historických jednotek! Samotné jednotky fungují na základě reality a je jich opravdu spousta. Opevněné města musíte nejlépe vybombardovat nebo použít dělostrřelectvo. Tanky používat jen v otevřeném prostoru a na průlomy. Obsazování letišť, vzdušná převaha, výsadky parašutistů, námořní souboje... Hra dokonce pracuje i s municí a palivem.

 V kampani nehrajete jen za wehrmacht ale i za další "spojence" osy. Takže i za slováky, italy a spoustu dalších. Trošku negativně hodnotím systém DLC, které jsou poměrně drahé. Takže pak máte pocit že zákaldní hra je jen takový starter kit. Podle všeho jde ale o obrovské DLC o několik úrovňí kvalitnější než základní hra. Celkově jde o neprávem zapadlý drahokam, který by měl vyzkoušet každý opravdový fanoušek tahových strategií.

21875059.review:
Panzer Corps es una joya que ha obtenido por méritos propios el título de "Sucesor de Panzer General 2". No es para menos, puesto que la jugabilidad es calcada y la estética y aspecto técnico también.

El juego tiene un buen puñado de misiones repartidas en campañas; escenarios sueltos; así como gran variedad de unidades. Tiene también una enciclopedia de unidades con ilustraciones y arte conceptual.

Existe a posibilidad de jugar online mediante sistema PBEM (Play By Email), esta vez adornado con la coletilla "Plus", que básicamente consiste en tener las partidas listadas y centralizadas en un servidor, con notificaciones a cada jugador por email, previo registro en Slitherine.

Existe la posibilidad de añadir mods, aunque se echa de menos que estos estén integrados en la plataforma Steam Workshop con la comodidad que esto conlleva.

Aunque el juego es una maravilla, tiene unos cuantos aspectos negativos como son:
-Precio alto incluso durante ofertas (Como prácticamente todos los juegos de Slitherine)
-Cantidad elevada de DLCs y expansiones.
-Música y efectos sonoros repetitivos.
-"Tiles" del mapa oscuros, pero sobretodo, monótonos.
-Modo multijugador en tiempo real inexistente.
-Falta de traducción al castellano (Para muchos no nos es problema, pero duele, sabiendo que está en inglés, francés, alemán y ruso)

Para mí, no supera al Panzer General 2 original. Será que soy un romántico y prefiero los píxeles o le doy mucho aún al Open General de Luis Guzmán. En cualquier caso, si eres aficionado a los wargames de no excesiva complejidad, a la WWII o a los buenos juegos de estrategia, es una compra MUY recomendada.

21690819.review:
This is the best tactical-level war game of all time. Its roots reach all the way into the 70's and AH's entry into the wargaming world, and has preserved all that is good and playable in a turn-based WWII game. The Best. Ever.
The DLCs work flawlessly, and each one adds significant depth to the games and dozens of hours of enjoyment. The 128 hours I've played so far are just on Steam; I've owned this game since it was first announced, and I've owned all the games it is based upon, all the way back to AH's Blitzkreig. 
I really can't say a single bad word about this game, as for me it is perfection (well, if it made breakfast that'd be great too.) It is not for the FPS guys or the RTS guys; however, if you can slow down and learn to enjoy a games depth and thoughtfulness and comprehensive presentations of conventional warfare in the 20th century, you will learn to love this game series.
The controls are elegant, the options are varied and make for an excellent adjustment to give you just the gaming experience you desire. The entire game can be played with just your mouse, although you can set and modify many keymaps. The game contains a wealth of historical and technical data and will allow the user to satifactorily recreate any time periond, battle sequence, or campaign from this massively important time in human history. The map has two levels of zoom and a strategic view as well, easily shifted between ground and air units, which is all the divisions you need to play this game seamlessly. This can be a casual, quick scenario game, or a deep and long-lsting campaign with units developing heroes, increased combat strengths, and upgrades. Most all military units are represented, easily identifiable, and movement and combat are simple click/click movements. It has a nice musical background and great yet simple audio battle sounds. You can save at any time, you can review a battlefield after conclusion, and it has more than adequate support for most all resolutions. It is not a computer hog for resources, and can run on older or less robust systems than most games.
I've never really had a technical issue, other than it getting a little sloggy after playing for 8 hours or so, and a simple save/restart cleared that up. With the release of the Soviet campaigns/scenarios, I can't wait to experience them from the Russian perspective; I will add to the review when I've played it a lot.
In case you glossed over it, this is the BEST turn-based WAR GAME EVER. Replayability is infinite, as is the enjoyment. It is not for every single person on the planet, but only for the intelligent, patient players who enjoy a brilliant design and a flawless execution of an elegantly simple, yet deep combat system. Forget to combine your arms in the proper order, and an easy victory will turn on it and defeat you. It can be played solo, hot-seat (both players in the room but each player only sits at the PC when it's their turn, or multiplayer and PBEM.

PERFECT. I cannot imagine recommending a game more enthusiastically than I recommend this one.

21475529.review:
Несмотря на то, что  Panzer Corps не пытается реалистично симулировать военные действия и хар-ки различной техники, - это умная, глубокая и сложная пошаговая стратегия и, несмотря на свою архаичную графическую оболочку (передвижение войск полноценно не анимировано), затягивает по полной! В отличие от казуального посмешища от UbiSoft - Panzer Online, Panzer Corps, по сути, является перезапуском легендарной серии варгеймов Panzer General, с сохранением всех элементов игрового процесса своего вдохновителя.

[h1]Что понравилось[/h1]

В Panzer Corps 800 различных боевых единиц (юнитов). Каждый юнит обладает 20 уникальными характеристиками и шкалой опыта. В процессе игры особо отличившиеся солдаты будут повышены и награждены множеством различных исторически достоверных медалей. У каждого подразделения есть собственная история: дата призыва, личный счет и портреты героев. 

Игровое поле разделено на гексы с 24 типами местности. 

Постоянно приходится учитывать кол-во боеприпасов, топлива для механизированных частей, контролировать пополнения с тыла и многое другое. Есть практически все виды войск (всего их 20): авиация, десант, корабли, поддержка и т.д... На очки престижа можно покупать и улучшать подразделения. После потери пары самолетов из-за пустого бака с горючим, начинаешь играть более предусмотрительно...

Купленные в процессе прохождения кампании юниты будут переходить от миссии к миссии, набираясь опыта, поэтому состав "личной армии" нужно беречь по максимуму, что изрядно прибавляет к сложности. 

Миссии в основном в режиме "блиц", то есть за определенное кол-во ходов нужно выполнять поставленные задачи - а это бывает очень непросто. Приходится думать, планировать и ни в коем случае не спешить. Panzer Corps - это такая игра, в которой ваш талант полководца может быть унижен уже в учебном сценарии...

Военный технический прогресс в то время стоял на первом месте, поэтому, чем позднее этап войны, тем более совершенная и разнообразная будет доступна техника. Например, легендарные немецкие танки PzKpfw VI «Тигры» пошли в первый бой в августе 1942 года, тогда как ранние версии не менее легендарных Т-34 были на вооружении советской армии ещё с 1940 года.

[h1]Стоит отметить:[/h1]

● [i]В базовой версии кампания только за Германию. В дополнениях есть кампании за CCCP и союзников.[/i]

● [i]Имеется внутриигровая энциклопедия, где описана историческая cводка по различным единицам вооружения.[/i] 

● [i]В Steam ошиблись, не отметив наличие русской озвучки - она там есть. Учитывая мелкий текст на FHD, озвучка брифингов пришлась кстати. Локализация выполнена на высоком грамматическом уровне.[/i]

● [i]Кроме того, она есть также на iOS и поддерживает кроссплатформенный сетевой режим - что несомненно хорошо для такого типа игр. [/i]


В общем, Panzer Corps - несомненно, игра  для серьезных мужчин!

21449312.review:
Welcome to the best strategy game made.  This game possesses a degree of complexity almost unseen in strategy games, bordering being almost impossible to truly understand.  Panzer Korps is also incredibly customizable, in a way that that virtually every single other strategy game is not.  Of similar importance, the game is incredibly historically accurate, which matters if you want to have an authentic gaming experience when playing historical strategy games.  When you play a game and a M4A4 "Sherman" drives up and one-shots a "Tiger", or IS-2, "LIKE A BOSS", then you may have a problem ;).  

Positive factors:
I) absolutely insane amount of complexity
II) ground breaking customizability
III) ranges from: easy-Erwin Rommel    (that means only a legend could beat the game)
IV) very historically accurate
V) even the Soviets are represented accurately and without ideological bias 
VI) endless *YEARS* of playtime (not hours, years)
VII) inclusion of numerous fictional plot lines

Of note:
1) this is a very thoughtful and intense game, thinking is required 
2) non-stop sexual themes and gore splattering are NOT part of this game
3) constant flashes, bright lights are not present either

Give this game a try and it will blow your mind.  Really an amazing game.  Definitely go watch the trailer, check out some pictures, read the description and then make an informed decision.  You will not be dissapointed!

21437859.review: This delivers great WWII operational-level wargaming. It has an easy enough interface, a tough phased strategy scheme, and lots of replay value. 21433387.review: I can only begin by suggesting that this is "Panzer General in HD". There are many (mostly visual) improvements and as many additional complications, but the game remains fundamentally the same-a somewhat simplified tactical wargame worthy of many classic board war games (thanks to TTG, WRG, SSI and their pioneering predecessors) and the original PG itself, born of those little cheap boxed map-and-counter games those of us old or keen enough to remember started with. I would recommend the basic game at the start-veterans may miss the irritating arbitrariness of the original (weather and supply reducing the game to a perfect and deeply aggravating historic re-enactment are still optional, thank goodness!), but I believe as a veteran tabletop wargamer of thirty years that you will still find the challenge inherent in the original game, but with some shiny extra features that may please you. I must add that I am currently ploughing through the original game, crrently on sale (24 Feb 2016) and as such I must also add that DLC is also available. However I have chosen to avoid the DLC for now until I am familiar with the main game, in order to ensure that I know what I am letting myself in for. Feel free to do as you like, but as an "old sweat" familiar with long drawn-out military campaigns fought from the safety of my own four walls, this will do and saves me hours of setting up a table and putting it all away afterwards.

21302200.review: Come wargamer e un appassionato di WW2 potrei non essere tale obiettivo quando sto dicendo che di questo gioco dannatamente bene! Allo stesso tempo, però, le ore passate (non solo su questo, ma altri wargames pure) cercando di battere la campagna su feldmaresciallo, mettendo alla prova le mie capacità con la gente sul multiplayer, esplorando il gioco su più livelli, fare concedimi un ben pensato fuori parere di questo gioco, spero: P ! su con una breve presentazione del gioco Panzer Corps Wehrmacht (PC) è una luce, a turni (Igo-Ugo) gioco di strategia e di una reimplementazione della vecchia scuola Panzer General (PG) . Se ti è piaciuto PG sarà quasi sicuramente godere PC e il contrario di corso. L'idea è semplice. Si inizia la seconda guerra mondiale comandante parte dell'esercito tedesco, a partire dalla invasione della Polonia e decidere il suo destino con la possibilità che vanno, a seconda delle prestazioni, dalla sua fine storica di uno spoiler * minore * . Il divertimento del gioco deriva attraverso la sua semplicità tattica se si lascia un sacco di spazio per la profondità per coloro che sono disposti a cercarlo. Tutto quello che dovete fare è spostare e fuoco le vostre unità in qualsiasi ordine desiderato. Abbastanza semplice, eh? Certo, ma al fine di padroneggiare il gioco, è necessario cogliere molti meccanismi sottili. Panzer Corps caratteristiche: una varietà di terreni con caratteristiche uniche, la soppressione unità, un sistema interessante iniziativa, unità di ritiro / consegna, un sistema di tempo, di alimentazione (anche se in una forma non realistica a causa della mancanza di linee di alimentazione), radicamento, zona di controllo , ridispiegamento strategico e molti elementi più interessanti. Inoltre, il gioco è dotato di molte unità che, oltre al cromo, offrono molte opportunità tattiche. Vuoi arare il campo di battaglia con movimento lento re tigri o Blitz con i carri armati Panther? Vuole dominare i cieli con una / forza bombardieri in picchiata caccia combinate o seguire una dottrina cacciabombardiere? A causa dei molti tipi di unità differenti offerti, l'efficienza delle armi combinate brilla davvero. Un altro aspetto della Panzer Corps è il suo elemento strategico ma coinvolgente sottile. Si è data il comando di una forza di base che si controlla attraverso l'intero gioco, in contrasto con un paio di unità secondarie / temporanei che vengono forniti per un unico scenario. Questa forza di base può essere ampliato con l'acquisto / aggiornamento unità tra o durante gli scenari, ma, nota amichevole, non cercare di capire la scala; unità possono rappresentare divisioni, corpi, o addirittura eserciti, a seconda della portata dello scenario. Inoltre, ogni unità guadagna esperienza attraverso il combattimento e il dilemma di come sostituire perde, attraverso regolari (inesperti e poco costosi) o Elite (battaglia-indurito e costosi) sostituzioni, si pone. Questo naturalmente significa che devo spiegare il prestigio e ... Prestige (la valuta del gioco) dipende dalla vostra performance sullo scenario. Questa è la cattura di obiettivi (primario / secondario) e il risultato di battaglia (normale / decisiva vittoria o la sconfitta). Una vittoria decisiva può avere a venire molte volte con logorio che può costare nel lungo periodo. Anche i più scelte! Tuttavia non tutto è grande ... Per cominciare, l'IA è relativamente banale. Non agisce terribilmente astoricamente o semplicemente stupido (oltre a due situazioni rare) ma la difficoltà della maggior parte degli scenari passa attraverso il vantaggio numerico del nemico. Poi abbiamo gli obiettivi ripetitivi, almeno in Wehrmacht, "Cattura tutte le città in X giri". Alcune persone nag per la mancanza di rigiocabilità pure ma mi permetto di dissentire. Oltre alla campagna di ramificazione e gli scenari multiplayer (può essere giocato sia online che hotseat) ci sono un sacco di mods a vostra disposizione gratis! Un'altra cosa che mi infastidiva il fatto che, anche se vi è la possibilità di una scheda dettagliata di battaglia sia prima e dopo ogni combattimento, il gioco manca di dettagli sia nel tutorial e il manuale. Questo lascia chi vuole scavare più a fondo altra scelta che passare attraverso molti post del forum. Per esempio artiglieria ha un tasso di stat fuoco che non è menzionato in qualsiasi parte del gioco! Ogni pezzo di base delle informazioni è coperto comunque e l'interfaccia, in molti casi, è intuitivo ed elegante. Infine, il problema si pone realismo. A causa della sua natura astratta questo gioco è ben lungi dall'essere una simulazione a livello strategico. La mancanza di molti dettagli importanti rendono realistico a livello tattico pure. Nel suo cuore però ogni decisione il giocatore fa è realistico, in un certo senso che gli stessi dilemmi sorti ai generali WW2 pure. In qualche modo, attraverso l'attenta detrazione dal realismo, il gioco riesce a rimanere fedele, tanto quanto un wargame leggero possibile, per la natura della guerra.

21140951.review:
[h1]About the game:[/h1]
First off, it's a [i]hex grid, turn based strategy game[/i]. You know, one of [u]those[/u] old strategy games from the 90's! It's actually an attempt to recreate Panzer General, which is a strategy game loved by many. By [b]ME[/b], anyway! If you don't know what Panzer General is, it's a virtual board game with hidden dice rolls, pretty basic audio and very minimal animation. 

Some of you might be turned off by the sound of that, but I think that this game incredibly immersive. I get frustrated when my enemy scores a rugged defense that thwarts my planned attack! I am fillled with joy when one of my units decimates the enemy and a hero emerges. I'm quite confident in saying that when you lose one of your units either due to a bad roll or just poor judgement, you will consider loading an older save to try and keep them alive.

[h1]Some mechanics of the game:[/h1]
Each mission begins with specific set of auxilliary units. Auxiliary units are specifically set for only that mission so you won't have control of after them after the mission is finished. You could use them for dangerous situations because there's no real consequence for losing them. I wouldn't suggest just throwing them away, but sometimes that's what they are there for. Auxiliary units are represented by a grey color around the strength box. You are given [b]"Prestige"[/b] at the start of each mission which is the currency of the game, used to buy your core units and reinforcing units [i](you also gain prestige by defeating enemies and capturing strategic points)[/i]. Core units are what you will have throughout the campaign so take good care of them! They have a golden ring around the strength box. 

Core units will perform better than auxiliary units in almost all occasions due to having higher experience which gives your units bonuses. Throughout the campaign new units will be unlocked and it's a good idea to upgrade your units. Upgrading your old Panzer II's up to Panzer III's for example. Your units gain experience through combat, medals through participation or deeds, and like I mentioned before, heroes through excellence. When you reinforce a damaged unit you can either use fresh recruits which are cheap but it reduces the experience of the unit as a whole, or veteran replacements which cost significantly more, but alow you to keep your current experience value.

Your units are represented by an icon and a strength number. The strength number represents the number of men available in the unit who can fight (it isn't literally 10 men or tanks, it's just a representation on a scale of 1 to 10+). Over time, through combat, your units can gain experience and levels. When they gain a level they can be reinforced to be an 'over strength' value. Over strength meaning that they can be brought up to 11, 12 or even 13 strength value. They will perform better of course, but the trade off is that it costs substantially more to reinforce the unit above 10.

Your units have more detailed statistics which range from: 

Attack values against soft [i](infantry, some artillery, trucks, etc)[/i], hard targets [i](tanks, half-tracks, bunkers, etc)[/i], air targets [i](.. planes, planes, etc)[/i] and naval attack [i](against ships der)[/i] 

Defense values for ground or air attacks and also what type of defense your unit uses [i](soft, hard, air or naval)[/i].

View range [i](how many hexes they can reveal)[/i]

Movement distance and what type of movement they use. Certain movement types travel over certain terrain types more easily than others. There is tracked, wheeled and good ol' fashion 'Leg'!.

Close Defense is how well the unit defends itself in urban or forest areas or when they are ambushed. 

Finally, 'Range' is how far the unit can attack from. Your standard infantry or tank unit can only attack enemies next to them. Artillery on the other hand can attack from a distance usually 2 to 3 hexes away.

Units also have an ammo count and if applicable a fuel count which both need to be resupplied after a while. Ammo is  how many attacks or defensive shots you can make before needing to use a turn to be resupplied (a unit without ammo cannot return fire which is something you can exploit!). Fuel is fairly self explaining, a unit uses 1 fuel for every hex it travels. Resupplying restores both ammo and fuel, so it's got that going for it..

[h1]TLDR;[/h1] The game, while it may look fairly simple by it's screenshots or videos, has a lot of complexity to it for you to use to your advantage and I find it highly rewarding.



[h1]Something about the campaigns:[/h1]

You start out with having tutorials teaching you the basics [i](you'll have to come up with your own strategies and tactics to get decisive victories!)[/i]. Then you move into the campaigns. You can choose from 4 with the base game which determine the time you want to start the war at and the battles you'll take part in. Some of the missions overlap in the campaigns but it depends on your choices and victories / losses. 

Someone made a neat chart that tells you which missions are in each campaign: http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/3318332566192367118/183E683584A5430315E3D95789E1D0CE1F7DE724/

As you can see on that chart, the base game has in total 40 different missions. Add to that that you can change your core army around which can make the same mission play very differently and you have yourself a lot of replayability! Want an army heavy with panzers and mechanized infantry to flank and destroy enemies from behind? Or how about one focusing on a large number of pioneers and artillery to break through ANY defense? The choice is yours and there are a lot of choices.

The game follows history to a certain degree, like when the war began and certain historical battle dates, but you can drastically alter history. For example: you can go as far as conquering the United States after conquering Russia.

I'd say that the 'Grand Campaign' DLC's are the way to play this. The base game is great, but it's sort of a 'lite' version. The GC goes into further detail with the stages of the war. Instead of 4 missions conquering Poland it's 10 or so [i](14 all together but there are branching choices and situations)[/i] but this is straying into a review for the DLC now.


[h1TLDR again?;[/h1] This game can be simple yet complex. Bland yet immersive. Yet, yet yet! Honestly, I think it's worth well over $20. It goes on sale once in a while so if you're on the fence just wait for one of those. This is definitely a game no strategy fan should miss.

I apologize for this poorly structured novela of a review. This is my first real 'review'  and any feedback or discussion is greatly appreciated. Want me to never write again? I'll see what I can do! Thanks for checking it out!

20957740.review:
I remember a young birthday when I used my money to buy some Airfix Matildas to help out against the Airfix Panzers on my tabletop desert battlefield. That was over 40 years ago and how things have changed... After progressing through the ZX Spectrum and Atari ST, I finally arrived at a 386DX and MS-DOS 5, a platform that was to develop into the best and most versatile gaming system the world has to offer.

There was Perfect General, Panzer General, History Line to name a few. I loved the simplicity of Panzer General 2 and Battle Isle 2 over the wargames with more complex rules, preferring to play than read rule books. Last year I discovered Panzer Corps and was amazed at how easy it was to pick up and play, it must be the most accesible wargame ever.

I've now played through the base game, and went back and replayed it a couple a times to make sure I had a go at all of the scenarios. I read a few tips to sharpen my game and have worked out the whole combined arms thing. I've moved on to Africa Korps on my laptop but I'm replaying the original game on my desktop on Field Marshal diffculty (my first go was on Colonel). I've bought all the DLC up to and including Sea Lion as I know it's going to take me a long time to tire of it.

For the hard core wargamer who likes a thick book of rules and calling up off map artillery and air support, ensuring tanks are facing the right way and every realism nailed down, Panzer Corps might be too simplistic. But for a more casual wargamer who wants to flick through a thin rule book and do his learning on the battlefield, it's perfect. There's a great support community on the Slitherine website, and DLC keeps getting released. Highly recommended for those who want to play a solid wargame without having to go on a course first.

20564782.review:
Derrière un design qui a priori ne paie pas de mine se cache un petit bijou au gameplay terriblement efficace ! On appréciera une campagne dynamique côté allemand qui mettra à l'épreuve votre maîtrise de la blitzkrieg : battez votre ennemi dans un nombre limité de tours et vous remporterez des victoires décisives qui pourront vous mener jusque sur le continent américain pour soumettre le monde entier à votre botte.
Pendant votre partie, utilisez les unités à disposition pour conquérir des objectifs clé qui vous feront gagner des points précieux, points qui vous permettront de recruter de nouvelles unités, chacune ayant son type et ses caractéristiques : infanterie légère et lourde, artillerie, blindés, reconnaissance, soutien, avions de transport et paras, chasseurs, bombardiers légers et lourds...tout ça dans une ambiance très bien retranscrite (les effets sonores sont terribles oO). Pour mener le combat, vous devrez utiliser le terrain à votre avantage et tenir compte de la météo qui pourra ralentir vos char et clouer vos avions au sol (l'hiver russe, un vrai bonheur...). Certaines de ces unités passeront au scénario suivante avec leur expérience acquise.

Parallèlement, des scénarios sont disponibles (dont ceux de la campagne), pour vous entraîner ou pour jouer l'autre camp (essayez donc de repousser l'invasion allemande avec la Pologne :p, ou défendez héroïquement Stalingrad).

Plusieurs contenus additionnels ajoutent de la durée de vie au jeu : Afrika Korps offrant une campagne dynamique sur le continent nord-africain, Allied Corps qui vous permet de jouer une campagne côté allié, Soviet Corps qui se concentre exclusivement sur l'armée rouge ou encore Sea Lion qui vous permet de jouer un scénario ahistorique d'invasion de l'Angleterre par l'Allemagne. 

Des campagnes additionnelles sont disponibles côté allemand et proposent des scénarios originaux (campagne complète de 39 en Pologne, de 1940 en France, etc), de même que trois campagnes US basées sur le même principe (42, 43 et 44-45).

Bref, tout ça c'est très bien mais petit bémol, il faudra débourser pas mal d'argent pour avoir tout ça (pensez à regarder du côté de la version Gold tout de même). Cela dit le jeu de base est déjà pour qui veut découvrir le genre.

19870956.review:
Старый добрый Panzer General (а если купите дополнение, то и Allies General), со всеми своими плюсами и минусами. В плюсе имеем добротный гексагональный варгейм-стратегию на тему WWII, прекрасно идет на 64 bit, много карт (дополнения прилагаются). Wer die Panzer-General-Spiele aus den 90ern kennt und mag, der findet sich in Panzercorps schnell zurecht. Es ist nämlich nahezu das gleiche Spiel und selbst das UI wurde weitgehend übernommen. Warum auch neu erfinden, wenn dass alte gut und zweckmäßig war?!

Ich empfehle die "Great Campaign". Sechs Kriegsjahre mit neun Kampagnen und jeweils 10 Einzelschlachten bieten lange Zeit Futter für den Feierabend-Strategen. Und die werden immer schwerer, besonders im Ostfeldzug kämpfte man gegen eine Flut von sowjetischen Panzern. Wer da nicht vorgeplant, die Armee aufgelevelt und Ruhmpunkte gebunkert hat, dem stellen sich unlösbare Aufgaben. 

Die Verbesserungen zum PG aus dem Jahre 94 sind nicht gewaltig, aber durchaus spürbar und lassen das Spiel noch leichter von der Hand gehen. Grafik ist mit 2 D- Sicht Nebensache. Beim Schach würde auch keiner die Grafik loben. Und Panzercorps ist soetwas wie Panzerschach: Ein Gegner, rundenbasiert, Symbole die die Einheiten, Felder und Ziele, Strategie und Taktik.

Einziger Nachteil: Selbst im Angebot ist Panzercorp doch recht teuer.

19538868.review:
This is one of those games I wish I could give a neutral rating to but since I can't, I'm giving it a thumbs down. This game has great ratings, so you can read many other reviews on why PC is a good game. It does many things right - a neat branching scenario structure, solid foundation and some good voice overs to introduce the scenarios. For me, thats not enough and thus I'm going to explain why I don't think it's good enough to get a thumbs up.

Simply put, PC is a remake of the old Panzer General games. And after playing this for 20 hours and playing those, I still think they're better games for one main reason: the Panzer Corps scenarios are usually very flawed.  

Panzer Corps makes the mistake of having too many units on too small of a map. There is little to no room for manuever. Thus the game is more puzzle-based than it is tactical. It's just a matter of figuring out that at "x" chokepoint I need 3 infantry, 1 arty and a tank to bust through. Once I know that, it's a matter of going to the next chokepoint. The time frames are always very tight, which rewards perfect unit usage and not necessarily good tactics. Seriously, whether you win or lose in any given map is often decided by your first half dozen combat results - if they're very favorable you're golden. If not, you're probably totally screwed.

There are two types of battles - you're on the offense and you're on the defense. If you're on the offense, the AI is going to just sit back and let you come to them. There's no ebb and flow here - it's all a matter of finding the "right" way to knock down yet another brick wall. After playing a number of these scenarios, I felt like the Allies trying to fight through the German hedgerows - frustratingly slow, brute-force combat tactics because you can't manuever. It gets old, fast. 

If you're on defense, you can expect overwhelming odds since the AI isn't as effective as a human. So those scenarios are gamed up to present a challenge in numbers since the AI can't do it otherwise. They were, in a nutshell, disappointing. 

There are other issues as well. I find the map to be muddled and not attractive. It's a wargame, I know, and it doesn't need to be beautiful. But I'd personally rather have counters than the muddled color scheme presented here. The branching campaign is pretty neat but has some real issues - for instance, if do well enough as Germany and you're going to presented with an almost unwinable scenario in the USA. Do slightly worse and delay the US invasion by two years and you'll have a far more winnable scenario. That's just bad design. Sea power has almost no part in the game as well, so it's all ground and air combat. Combined arms need not apply in most scenarios. 

But it all goes back to scenario design - too many units, too small maps, no manuever and thus no imagination. I found them constricting. So why would I advocate paying for Panzer Corps (and don't get me started on the absurd DLC prices) when the old Panzer General II does it better? I can't. I'd rather play PG than PC and therefore PC gets the thumbs down. For those who are interested in the genre, I recommend Order of Battle: Pacific. It's a very similar game with larger maps, more fluid combat, combined arms and the maps aren't as muddled. To me it's a far superior game and easily worth the price difference.

19475456.review:
I have been playing strategy games for almost 25 years. I love them. I am not an expert, but I am not bad at all.

It is extremely uncommon for me not to find any flaws in a game. There is always something wrong.

I have been thinking about buying this for a long time, because I have bought some games before, and just after that I have lost my motivation to play them.

But now, after 11 hours of intensive playing I think, that this game is PERFECT. I am really amazed how everything has been thought out. UI is extremely useful, intuitive, and everything, what you would expect, is shown in the right place.

AI is amazing. Many times, I just wanted to rush and moved my artillery (or support units) ahead into a theoretically safe area. And every time some AI units jumped in and slayed them like little kittens. AI behaves almost exactly like a human. It will exploit all your weaknesses. All of them. No regret, no remorse.

I have skipped built in campaigns and have bought Grand Campaign '39. And, if you think, that conquering Poland is piece of cake, you are SO WRONG. 7 hours of playing and I have just came into the third scenario. Campaign is thought out very well. The map is not 100% accurate, but it does include all the terrain features that you would expect, type of units (lots of Polish infantry, but not a match for Wermacht, lots of AT guns, and great Polish cavalry), and strategic objectives of that time (ie. bridges in Northern Poland). It also features successful Polish counter offensive near Bzura river - in that scenario you really need to be careful with every move you make. I live in Gdansk, former Danzig, the place where IIWW broke out, so I know what I am talking about.

Tutorial is just great and very informative. It doesn't treat you like a child trying to learn you how to click with your mouse. It focuses on the most important stuff.

If I had the opportunity, I would come back in time and SLAP my past-me in the face. Just for thinking too much.
Well, I don't have an access to a time machine, but don't do the same mistake... because the future-you could have...

Do you remember, what I said at the beginning? It is extremely uncommon for me not to find any flaws in a game. This is the first time. Panzer Corps has no flaws at all.

Just buy it. If you love strategy games, this would be AT LEAST one of the best games you would ever play.

19450292.review:
Panzer Corps is a fun and accessible war-game. I know, I know hexes are scary but don’t let that deter you too much. If you can put up with a little sparsity in its presentation Panzer Corps is an engaging and expansive strategy game.

The base campaign sees you taking control of the German army during WW2 and you will visit most of the fronts in the European war. The game also uses a semi dynamic campaign which will give you access to new missions depending on your performance.

It also features my favorite thing in strategy games, persistent units. througout the campaign your units will gain experience and perks that in the end can have a big effect on your units survivability. It almost goes without saying that your dead units will stay dead. A more personalized core force might have been even better but what is there is engaging and fun.

In the end Panzer Corps is fun and easy get started in and I reccommend it to anyone who likes a bit more challenge in their strategy games without going full Hearts of iron. The only thing I can really say against it is that it might be a tad over priced without a sale and that its simple presentation makes the ipad version more attractive than the PC.

Nice modernization of legendary Panzer General.

Pros:
- Simplest user interface ever in PG series!
- Railroad system is a nice new feature;
- Heroes and medals make you really attached to your veteran units;
- Well represented weather;
- Change in game mechanics: Suppression caused to defending unit lasts whole turn, making 'softening' the defenders both realistic and working tactic.
- Nice "what if" scenarios allow other ways to end your campaing than just defending Berlin.

Cons:
- Change in game mechanics: Only artillery batteries adjacent NEXT TO defending unit provide defensive artillery fire; no matter if they have more range than 2, they only defend adjacent units :(
- Change in game mechanics: Tanks no longer have "overrun attack" ability :(
- Base game has a quite few scenarios; Operation Torch, or Market-Garden, for example, were MAJOR events of the war, and fully omitted --> after one playthroug you start to miss DLC's...

18719803.review:
このゲーム面白いです。
往年の大戦略シリーズの正当進化版とでもいうべき内容でとても面白い。

主要な違いは、対空砲が弱体化されており、爆撃機が大活躍します。（戦闘機は天敵）
結構ダイナミックに攻めれるのですが、そのためターン制限が苦しいです。
また、ユニットごとに成長システムがありＲＰＧ要素もあります。歴戦の英雄をつくりだせば戦況を有利にすすめることができます。

最も重要なのは如何に相手を崩すかを考えることであり、物量をそろえて寄せれば勝てるという仕様になってはいません。
常に相手の一番手薄なところを探して攻める。これを意識しないと勝てません。川、森、山とにかく地形を友達にしないといけません。
だから、パンツァークラップって銘打ってる割に、戦車無双出来ません＾＾；。
市街地攻略が多いので、戦車には市街地攻略時にマイナス補正が強くかかるため、相対的に歩兵のほうが使いやすい。
歩兵は特徴の違う兵種が８種あり多彩な戦闘が可能です。

いい点＆悪い点なんですけど、カリカリのターン制限の割には、ランダム性が存在しており、雨降ってて爆撃出来ない
とか、少数の敵がこもる都市が微妙に落とせないという事態が発生し、イライラが＾＾；
でも上手くいったときは、だからこそ会心の喜びがあるという。二項背反。

英語環境なんだけど、別にわからなくても遊べると思います。ルールはオーソドックスなので。

18085914.review:
[h1]A Panzer Corps Review[/h1]

As a wargamer and a WW2 enthusiast I might not be that objective when I'm saying that this game's pretty damn good! At the same time however, the hours spent (not only on this but other wargames as well) trying to beat the campaign on Field Marshal, testing my skills with people on multiplayer, exploring the game on many levels, do grant me a well thought out opinion of this game, I hope :P

[b][i]On with a brief presentation of the game![/i][/b]
Panzer Corps Wehrmacht (PC) is a light, turn based (Igo-Ugo) strategy game and a reimplementation of the old school Panzer General (PG). If you liked PG you'll almost definitely enjoy PC and the opposite of course. The idea is simple. You start the second world war commanding part of the German army, starting from the invasion of Poland and decide its fate with possibilities ranging, depending on your performance, from its historical demise to a *minor spoiler* [spoiler]glorious blitzkrieg through the entire US[/spoiler].

[b][i]The fun of the game derives through its tactical simplicity though it leaves a lot of room for depth—for those willing to look for it.[/i][/b]
All you have to do is move and fire your units in any order you desire. Simple enough, huh?
Sure, but in order to master the game, you have to grasp many subtle mechanisms. Panzer Corps features: a variety of terrain with unique characteristics, unit suppression, an interesting initiative system, unit retreat/surrender, a weather system, supply (albeit in an unrealistic form due to the lack of supply lines), entrenchment, zone of control, strategic redeployment and many more interesting elements.

Furthermore the game comes with many units that, besides chrome, offer many tactical opportunities. Will you plow the battlefield with slow moving King Tigers or blitz with Panther tanks? Will you dominate the skies with a combined fighters/dive bombers force or follow a fighter-bomber doctrine? Due to the many different unit types offered, the efficiency of combined arms really shines.

[b][i]Another aspect of Panzer Corps is its subtle yet engaging strategic element.[/i][/b]
You are given command of a core force that you control through the entire game, in contrast to a couple of secondary/temporary units that are provided for a single scenario. This core force can be expanded by buying/upgrading units between or during the scenarios but, friendly note, don't try to figure the scale; units may represent divisions, corps, or even armies, depending on the scope of the scenario. In addition, every unit gains experience through combat and the dilemma of how to replace loses, through regular (inexperienced and cheap) or elite (battle-hardened and expensive) replacements, arises. This of course means I have to explain prestige as well...

Prestige (the game currency) depends on your performance on the scenario. That is the capture of objectives (primary/secondary) and the battle outcome (normal/decisive victory or defeat). A decisive victory may have to come many times through attrition which may cost in the long-run. Even more choices!

[i][b]However not everything's great...[/b][/i]
To begin with, the A.I. is relatively uninspired. It doesn't act terribly ahistorically or plain silly (besides two rare situations) but the difficulty of most scenarios comes through the numerical advantage of the enemy. Then we have the repetitive objectives, at least in Wehrmacht, "Capture all cities in X turns". A few people nag about the lack of replay value as well but I beg to differ. Besides the branching campaign and the multiplayer scenarios (can be played both online and hotseat) there are a lot mods at your disposal for free!

Another thing that bugged me is the fact that, although there is an option of a detailed battle sheet both before and after each combat, the game lacks detail both in the tutorial and the manual. This leaves those eager to dig deeper no option other than to go through many forum posts. For example artillery has a rate of fire stat that isn't mentioned anywhere in the game! Every basic piece of information is covered however and the interface, in most cases, is intuitive and elegant.

Finally, the realism issue arises. Due to its abstract nature this game is far from a simulation at a strategic level. The lack of many important details make it unrealistic at a tactical level as well. At its heart however every decision the player makes is realistic, in a sense that the same dilemmas arose to WW2 generals as well. Somehow, through the careful deduction from realism, this game manages to remain true, as much as a light wargame can, to the nature of the war.

[b][i]All in all, Panzer Corps is a strategy game I would recommend to everyone; both the uninitiated who wants to discover the joys of wargaming and the grognard who wishes for a less complex game.[/i]

[u]Rating:[/u] 9/10[/b]

17467690.review: I was a big fan of the original Panzer General in the 90's.  Panzer Corps is a nice clone, but there are several drawbacks from the original.  Graphics wise there have been SOME improvements but some nice features of the original PG were left out. Minor details that might not be important to some but I think add a lot to the experience.  The objectives in Panzer Corps also are really difficult to acheive if you play with the fog of war on and anything above easy difficulty, which is really unfortunate.  In the original PG you had enough moves to achieve your objectives and have a decent shot of getting major/decisive victories, but not so in Panzer Corps.  I'm not sure what the developers were thinking as most maps you have between 10 and 13 moves to capture all objectives (for decisive victory) which on most maps is impossible.  Lastly, as a lot of reviewers have noted the game has only a fraction of the scenarios the original PG had, so you have to buy all the stupid DLC's to get the full package, which is a TOTAL ripoff.  My advice is to try and find a copy of the original PG for free and play that.  However you might like Panzer Corps for brief nostalgia.

17281954.review:
Ein absolut gelungenes (wenn auch inoffizielles) Remake von "Panzer General (1)" aus den 90ern.

Im Grunde kann man fast von einer 1-1 Umsetzung reden, wobei die wenigen Änderungen auch
tatsächlich Verbesserungen im Detail darstellen.

Graphisch bleibt man dem 2d-Stil des Originals treu, natürlich Zeitgemäß umgesetzt und detailierter,
nur die Animationen sind wie im Original eher zweckmässig, was aber hier keinen Nachteil darstellt.

Die Parameter der Einheiten lassen sich jederzeit sehr übersichtlich einblenden und sogar
beim Aufrüsten einer Einheit (neu) vergleichen.
Ebenfalls neu sind Auszeichnungen und dadurch kleine Boni die Einheiten zusätzlich zur gewonnen Erfahrung
erhalten können, dies ist jedoch sehr selten, stört die Balance nicht maßgeblich,
erweitert aber die taktischen Möglichkeiten.
Abgerundet wird der theoretische Teil noch mit einem Ingame-Lexicon mit einigen Informationen
und hübschen handgezeichneten Schnittzeichnungen der Schlüssel-Einheiten aller Parteien.

Das Interface erinnert fast 1 zu 1 an das Original wobei auch hier, wie bei der Bedienung,
kleine verbesserungen vorgenommen wurden.
So sieht man nun auf der Übersichtskarte auf den ersten Blick welche Einheiten noch agieren können,
und auch an den Einheiten selber befinden sich nun kleine Icons ob noch Bewegungen oder ein Angriff ausgeführt
werden können.

Was direkt zur wichtigsten Neuerung in der Bedienung führt:
der Angriff muss nicht mehr direkt nach der Bewegung erfolgen wodurch endlich
vernüftige Flanken und Umgehungsangriffe möglich werden.
Erhöht die taktische Tiefe immens (und damit ist auch einer der größten Kritikpunkte von PG-1 ausgemerzt)
zumal wie im Original solche Angriffe Boni erhalten und eig elementar sind.

Letztlich wurde auch die Ki stark verbessert
(wärend man im 1990er Original eher mit den begrenzten Spielrunden zu kämpfen hatte als mit den Gegnern),
startet im Remake die KI durchaus auch Gegenangriffe, zieht Truppen zur Aufrischung zurück oder bewegt
sinnvolle Gruppenkombinationen.
Einiges mag auch je nach Karte gescriptet sein denoch reagiert die KI glaubwürdiger als im Original.

Also alles in allem nur (durchaus notwendige) Änderungen/Verbesserungen im Detail,
ansonsten blieb das geniale Konzept von Panzer General unangetastet,
und genauso will ich auch die Remakes alter Klassiker haben!

Wer Panzergeneral mochte oder ähnliche Spiele wie "History Line" / "Battle Island" (amiga) 
oder allg einen Draht zu Rundenstrategie spielen hat,
kann hier bedenkenlos zugreifen.
 
Wie im Original ändert sich der Kriegsverlauf je nachdem wie gut man die einzelnen Schauplätze bewältigt,
so das man bei einem Durchlauf nicht alle Karten zu sehen bekommt.
Bewältigt man zb den Westfeldzug besonders zügig/erfolgreich kann man versuchen in einem Bonusszenario
England zu erobern, ähnliches gilt für Moskau an der Ostfront, und ist man auch dabei erfolgreich wartet
am Ende sogar die Eroberung der USA auf den Spieler.
Wiederspielwert ist also durchaus gegeben.

Die Hauptkampagne ist allerdings nicht sehr Umfangreich,
Ich emfehle die "grand campaign dlc" gleich mit zu kaufen.
dieser dlc ist im grunde wie die Hauptkampagne jedoch ausführlicher dh länger mit mehr Karten.
 
das spiel ist die 19.- auf jedenfall wert, ich hatte den sale verpasst fand den preis aber auch so oke.

16828706.review:
A wonderful modern homage to Panzer General II. 

If you like turn-based strategy games you will love this game. 

If you like the WWII setting you will love this game.

The variety and availability of units, scenarios, and setups all are done with a nod to historical accuracy.  

The AI seems adequate and offers two settings along with further tweaks in the assignment of "prestige" which is the currency both you and the AI spend for units and reinforcements. The default seemed a touch too easy but with the selection of AI 2 and increasing AI prestige I've got all the fight I want from the computer and more.

Very fun. Just what I was looking for. 

Suggestions for improvement (or for a sequel) from me include:

1) better color highlighting of units to distinguish friend from foe. My eyesight isn't what it used to be.
2) better dynamic zooming of the battlefield instead of just  "in and out" with the map (ala sid meyer games) 
3) More detailed battlefield projection tooltips*

*What I mean here is instead of a hover forcast of projection win-loss if I commit to an attack I would like not only those numbers but below them i would like a quick summary of why--i.e. why I am forcasted to lose 5 or half my strength is because my unit has a horrible hard attack and I am attacking a triple fortified hard opponent for example. 

I know I can find this information out by clicking each individual unit and will learn certain characteristics over time, but it would be nice to have some of this at hand without the additional clicking and number crunching.

Very much recommend this game!

16563392.review: This is like the talented son of Panzer General II! If you're looking for graphics and flashy animations, look elsewhere. This is old school "Just one more turn as the hours go by quickly" gameplay. It's pretty basic, but quite strategic. Move all your units during your turn, then the computer does the same. The great thing about this game is that you can customize your army as you see fit. If you like a massive airforce with a few tanks to use blitzkrieg tactics...do it! Do you like to use artillery to soften up city defenses before sending in the troops...it's there. some strategies work better than others, but no matter how you play it....IT'S FUN....and so addictive.  Change history...invade England...invade the USA...if you're good enough. Spending your prestige points after battles is like opening presents at Christmas. Pay no attention to my hours on this game...I purchased it a long time ago from the original producers and have over 1500 hours logged in. Purchased every expansion and to this day I still play it weekly...my most played game ever.  One of the things I really like is that periodically a unit will get a bonus modifier applied to it as a reward (+3 Attack, +1 defense, +1 spotting, etc.) These modifiers actually make the unit noticeably better so it truly feels like a reward. As units gain experience in scenarios, you can also overpower them making stronger as the war progresses and when new technology arrives you can even upgrade them! I personally like the campaign modes and I like to try and rewrite history. Difficulty is adjustable as well as prestige points which allows you to upgrade and purchase new units. You can set it to be hard as hell or make it so easy that you just annihilate the enemy. Love the navy units as well! If you ever played Panzer General II and liked it, you'll feel right at home here. Lots of fun!!

15710331.review:
Jawoll, Generalfeldmarschall!
Accessibility: 9/10
Replayability: 8/10
Graphics: 6/10
Sound: 8/10

Panzer Corps is an accessible wargamer in the tradition of Panzer General. As the name suggests, it is a Korps-level wargamer that focus on maneuver and combined arms tactics. It eschews complex supply lines and routes in favor of easy to understand icons and actions. Playing a grand campaign from the cobbled stones of Poland in 1939 to the plains of Ukraine in 1943 and back to ruined Berlin in 1945 is gratifying in the sense that you get a sense of ownership in the accomplishment of your units. They will earn their Ritterkreuz, and so will you too if you last that long. 
Multiplayer is good, not exceptional. Be prepared for a long evening if you so chose to play.
A serious quibble in this otherwise impeccable game is the DLC's which seem to pester and tease gamers with content. The DLC's are quite enjoyable in its own right but not worth the asking price. Get the core game, it is worth it. Get the DLC's when they are on sale.

14668568.review:
Wer sich noch an das gute, alte Panzer General erinnern kann liegt hier nicht falsch. Ganz großer Kritikpunkt sind die sich wiederholenden Missionen aus eben diesem Panzer General. Die Karten fallen hier, im Hauptspiel, total winzig aus. Allein Norwegen (2. Mission) ist nur ein Viertel von dem was im Original geboten wurde. Das ist richtig bitter... Abgespeckte Optionen machen das nicht unbedingt besser. Man fühlt sich einfach nicht zu Hause und hat ständig das Gefühl daß man dieses Game, auch auf dem Handy zocken kann. Leichte Unterhaltung für Nebenbei. Hier fehlt der Tiefgang und die strategischen Möglichkeiten.
Der Soundtrack ist gewohnt altbacken, die Soundeffekte haben eine Renaissance erlebt. Sehr schön. Das wars aber auch mit der Lobhudelei ;) Ich wage es gar nicht über 70,- Euro auszugeben um das komplette Erlebniss zu haben. Für diese Klasse von Spiel sind 20 Euro schon zu viel. Leider..
Ich persönlich hab mich auf etwas Nostalgie gefreut, aber die kommt hier einfach nicht auf. Wenn man schon so derbe kopiert dann kann man ja wenigstens richtig klauen, und was besseres draus machen. Allerdings ist hier der Preis völlig überzogen für eine schlechte Panzer General Kopie.

13900501.review:
When I was a kid, my father bought a copy of Panzer General by SSI for Christmas. The two of us played it to death. The same thing happened to PGII, PGIII, and People's General after their releases. PG and PGII were my top two favourite strategy games of all time. The right amount of depth and history for my mediocre mind, and I had the time to think about it. God bless you, turn-based strategy category.

I have been chasing that kind of game ever since. A friend of mine bought the whole big package and I looked up reviews for the game. "....the spiritual sequel to the Panzer General series ..."  What? No! It can't be.

Oh. It can be. And it is. Trains, planes, troops, tanks, and automobiles. Hexagons and more theatres of war than you can shake a stick at.

I've come home.

13891740.review:
Panzer General reborn!

Ever since I got hooked on the original in 1994 I've wanted for someone to make a remake of it. 20 years later, not only that the remake is here, it's everything I've wanted.

A classic turn-based, hex-based strategy at its best, something that requires thinking and planning of troop deployment and movement, something that is SO different from the modern so-called RTS strategies that are a little more than a click-fest.

I'd reccomend it to anyone new who wants to try a real strategy, the "old hands" don't need to be told that :)

13854682.review:
Cuando se habla de este juego hay que comenzar reseñando ese gran juego de los años 90: Panzer General.
Los que hemos jugado a wargames de tablero como los que distribuía Nike&Cooper en España, juegos como "¿Resiste Stalingrado?" o "El día más largo" encontramos su similitud en pc en la seríe de juegos Panzer General: juegos de estrategia  sencillos por turnos, con tablero hexagonal y orientado en el escenario europeo de la segunda guerra mundial. Eran toda una delicia que por fin tuvo su modernización con Panzer Corps.

Porque Panzer Corps es un calco de Panzer General, un juego genial que en su configuración base tiene más de 30 escenarios de batalla distinto a los que se acceden según tu rendimiento en cada batalla, siempre jugando del bando alemán, de tal forma que podemos acabar invadiendo EEUU o podemos acabar perdiendo la guerra.

Además como expansiones existen la colección de campañas, afrika corps y allied corps (única forma de jugar como aliado). Pero las expansiones son bastante caras.

No puedo más que recomendar Panzer Corps, para los amantes de la estrategia bélica por turnos es el juego ideal.
